author: Andrea Alcalde
text: "I was so looking forward to liking this place
column5: we have friends that order sushi from here and have recommended this place to us in the past. We arrived around 8:30pm on Friday night
column6: so not too crowded
column7: got a table for two after a couple of minutes and proceeded to order right away. We wanted to try the pad Thai and a couple of sushi rolls
column9: we ordered the chicken pad Thai
column10: the Hoboken roll and the rock shrimp roll. They definitely forgot about the sushi order. The pad Thai came out and the sushi took another 15-20 min to come out. Two simple rolls
column13: this really ruined the experience for us. The pad Thai was pretty bland
column14: but is not a Thai place
column15: however the rock shrimp sushi seemed like it wasn't cooked all the way. Not as crunchy as you would expect. Overall the food was not good either. Service and food thumbs down. 2 star review because parking was super easy for Hoboken"

author: Melanie Tam
text: "Ordered here for takeout through Seamless. Took your standard 45-55 minutes during prime dinner hours.\n\nWe ordered the sushi for two (assorted sushi
column5: eel avocado roll
column6: and rainbow roll)
column7: which comes with two salads or soups. I wasn't a fan of the eel avocado roll but that's only because I don't like eel
column8: so I can't hold that against Okinawa. Other than that
column9: everything else was good.\n\nWe also ordered the Okinawa salad
column13: white tuna with seaweed salad and radishes. I was expecting more of a 'salad' but in reality
column14: it was just seaweed salad topped with chunks of tuna
column18: with a few pieces of radish haphazardly thrown in there. But at least the fish tasted fresh
column19: so that's all I really care about.\n\nThis seems to be the least expensive/best deal in the Jersey City/Hoboken area
column20: so I would definitely order from here when that sushi craving hits again (which is pretty often!)"

author: Rodney Barbee
text: 'Ordered delivery: Saturday Afternoon for 2ppl.    Delivery time: approx. 35mins.\nApps; Gyoza - GOOD/Avg
column5: Veggie Tempura - GOOD/Avg.\nSoup; Tom Kai w/Shrimp - GOOD/Avg
column6: however be aware there are only 2 shrimp for the additional $$.\nEntr√©e; 2 Chicken Teriyaki w/brown rice & salad (Kitchen Entree $14 not Lunch Box $10) -   Disappointing.  The chicken was dry (most likely pre-pkg
column7: heat & serve).   The chicken was served over snow peas
column8: very few mushroom slices and red onion (lots of red onion).  The red onion was over powering in both amount and taste (hot).\nI called to let them know I was unhappy with the entrees.  The manager was very apologetic and offered house credit
column9: restaurant policy.   I was able to get a refund of the entrees instead.\nWe were specifically looking for Teriyaki.  Most reviews has this as a top spot.  Guess that maybe for the Sushi.'
